result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Maxwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
--to make restitution of $2,360 payable to Glenn and  Linda Luczak; if the Agent determines during the term of Supervision that this amount was paid in part or in full by insurance, the Agent is to advise the Clerk of Court's Office of this and the clerk is to amend the Judgment of Conviction accordingly  (the Court notes that the amount consists of $1975 for damage to the vehicle, $250 insurance deductible, and $135 for car rental costs) 
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fee
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo any assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption  of any alcohol; no possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take precription medications only as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to submit to random drug and alcohol screens at the discretion of the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

  Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 8:31 AM 
Defendant Michael  Maxwell appears via video conferencing from Thompson Correctional, in custody. Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies name and date of birth. 

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.

On State's Motion to Reconsider the Court's Previous Order Granting Sentence Adjustment: 
--Court grants this motion, given ADA Shock was not given notice

On Defendant's Petition for Sentence Adjustment: 
--Arguments against given by ADA Shock 
--Arguments given by Mr. Maxwell


The Court has considered the file, previous arguments given by Mr. Maxwell.

The Court reverses its prior order, and now denies the order for sentence adjustment, because it is not in the interest of justice. 

recess: 8:46am
Re-Set Hearing. State to submit a written objection
Sentence adjustment review on February 28, 2019 at 08:30 am.

cases #14CF265, #14CF267 and #14CF405 called at 2:14pm. [MK]
Defendant Michael  Maxwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the Repeater allegation from the charging language in Counts #1, #2, #3, and #4 of Case #14CF265.

The subject charges and maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights given; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3, and #4 of Case #14CF265; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Shock submits the victim impact statement); the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Maxwell guilty of the four counts, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On agreement of the parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #5 of Case #14CF265 and the entirety of Cases #14CF267 and #14CF405.  As to Case #14CF405, service of the Criminal Complaint is admitted, reading is waived.


On Counts #1 of Case #14CF265, the Court sentences Mr. Maxwell to  5  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with the sentence in being.

On Counts #2, #3, and #4 of Case #14CF265 each concurrent, the Court sentences Mr. Maxwell to  7  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 5 years.  These sentences are to commence forthwith, concurrent with the sentence in being.

The Court finds that Mr. Maxwell is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives 100 days credit for time already served. (for the dates of 7/30/14 through 11/7/14).

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of any alcohol; no possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take precription medications only as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to submit to random drug and alcohol screens at the discretion of the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming as required by the Agent
--to make restitution of $2,360 payable to Glenn and  Linda Luczak; if the Agent determines during the term of Supervision that this amount was paid in part or in full by insurance, the Agent is to advise the Clerk of Court's Office of this and the clerk is to amend the Judgment of Conviction accordingly  (the Court notes that the amount consists of $1975 for damage to the vehicle, $250 insurance deductible, and $135 for car rental costs) 
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fee
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge per count [$2072 total]


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Statute 941.291 body armor prohibition imposed; penalties recited
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 3:04pm.

cases #14CF265, #14CF267, #14CF405 called at 11:09am. [MK]
Defendant Michael  Maxwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Huebner indicates that he has not been appointed as counsel in case #14CF405 yet. On agreement of the parties, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance in Case #14CF405.
ADA Shock indicates that the State is prepared to proceed to trial as scheduled in both cases #14CF265 and #14CF267 including that arrangements have been made for the witnesses to appear. 
Attorney Huebner indicates that he is not prepared to respond to the State's Motion to Impeach with prior convictions today. 
Attorney Huebner has no objection to the State's Notice to Admit Statements. 
Attorney Huebner indicates that there are no Miranda-Goodchild challenges to the statements.
As to Case #14CF265, the Court intends to carry an additional juror, so each party will have five strikes during jury selection; the panel should be of sufficient size so that there are approximately ten jurors other than those seated in the jury box for selection.
As to Case #14CF267, the Court does not intend to have an additional juror, so each party will have four strikes during jury selection. 
The Court indicates that it will accept any changes of plea prior to noon on Wednesday. 
recess 11:14am. 

NEXT:  
--Case 14CF265 will proceed on Thursday December 4th at 8:30am (the State's Motion to Impeach and any other procedural matters will be address by the Court and the parties at 8:30am and then the jury panel is to be prepared to begin the selection process at 8:45am. )
--Case 14CF267 will proceed on Friday December 5th at 8:30am (the jury panel is to be prepared to begin the selection process at 8:30am.)
--Case #14CF405 is to be rescheduled for Initial Appearance in approximately 1-2 weeks

cases #14CF265 & #14CF267 called at 1:57pm. [MK]
Defendant Michael  Maxwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Today's hearing is scheduled on the Defense oral Motion to Modify Bond. 
Attorney Huebner indicates that there has been no change in the case status; the trial date should remain on the Court's calendar.
Attorney Huebner argues in support of bond modification, including that Mr. Maxwell's father is very ill and under hospice-care, and that Mr. Maxwell is now on Probation. 
ADA Hall argues in opposition to bond modification. 
The Court denies the Motion to Modify Bond. 
recess 2:06pm. 

NEXT:  the 12/1/14 FSSC and 12/4/14 & 12/5/14 Jury Trials remain on the Court's calendar
Motion hearing on November 11, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Court denies defendant's request for reconsideration of bail modification or temproary furlough pc: all

Cases 14CF149, 14CF265, 14CF267 & 14CT71 called together at 1:46 pm [Clerk SH] 
Defendant Michael Maxwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews that cases are assigned to Judge Weston, since she is not available, set matter promptly due to liberties. Can adjourn hearing if Mr. Maxwell would prefer to have matter heard in front of Judge Weston.
Atty Huebner confirms that they are ready to proceed today
Arguments by Counsel

Court presents basis and grants bond modification and requires a $10,000 cash bond, to cover all cases, with all previously ordered non monetary conditions to remain the same.

cases #14CF149, #14CF265, #14CF267, #14CT71 called at 9:06am. 
Defendant Michael  Maxwell appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.
Attorney Huebner indicates that no resolution has been reached, so trial dates are needed.  The Defense is demanding speedy trial. 
recess 9:09am. 

NEXT:  schedule all four cases for FSSC and Jury Trial (the CT case within sixty days; the felony cases within ninety days);  Case #14CF149 is to be scheduled first in time, then Case #14CT71 next, and then Case #14CF265, and the Case #14CF267 last in time
Status conference on September 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 20, 2014 at 08:40 am.
States exhibits #1 & #2

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF149, #14CF265, #14CF267, #14CT71 called at 9:42am.
Defendant Michael Maxwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

In cases #14CF149 and #14CF267, Mr. Maxwell waives his right to Preliminary Hearing. The Court accepts these waivers and binds Mr. Maxwell over to trials in each case.
--------------------------
In case #14CF265, Preliminary Hearing is held:
Deputy Donald Petig- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Huebner
Closing argument given by Attorney Huebner. 
In Case #14CF265, the Court finds probable cause that Mr. Maxwell committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment held in Cases #14CF149, #14CF265, #14CF267:
--service of Informations admitted, readings waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered in all three cases
Attorney Huebner orally Motions to Reduce the $15,000 cash bond amount that was set by the Intake Court on August 4th.  Arguments given by Attorney Huebner.
The Court denies the Motion to Reduce the cash bond amount. 
recess 10:08am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/20/14 at 8:40am.  (2) schedule Status Conference approximately three weeks after the Pretrial date
Attorney Huebner
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case 14CT71 called at 1:17 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Michael Maxwell appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Karl Huebner. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Court reviews case file documents and indicates that the Court deems warrant to be satisfied
Court also now calls cases: 14CF265 & 14CF267 at 1:21 pm

14CF265 & 14CF267:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Court finds probable cause within complaint to support all charges

Court now also calls case 14CF149 - 1:33 pm 
Court reviews case file documents and indicates that warrant is satisfied
Bond arguments by Counsel

Court requires a $15,000 CASH bond, to cover all cases, with conditions:
-No contact with Glenn or Linda Luczak
-No presence at N9076 River Valley Rd. Ixonia
-Not drive a vehicle regardless of licensure
-Not leave State of Wisconsin

Court informs parties that It will set matters for preliminary hearing within 10 days
Court reviews conflict review worksheet; finds no conflict and endorses
Atty Huebner addresses that he had been appointed on earlier matters, given cash bond, now may qualify for SPD Services, If he does not qualify for SPD services, would request that be appointed on new matters. Court informs Atty Huebner that he will NOT appoint him as Counsel on the new cases, but will not that appeared for bond purposes only on new matters.
Recess: 1:51 pm

NEXT: ALL CF CASES (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 8/11/14 at 9:30 am - Send notices (2) Schedule 14CT71 as deemed appropriate  - Send notices
